page.title: 20St. John's Church Fete.
page.content: The fete took place on July 13th in St John's grounds and in the Church Hall. There was a variety of stalls such as the tombola, a wheel of fortune, and one with homemade cakes and other items of food. There was a white elephant stall selling second-hand clothes, shoes and toys. A lot of items were handmade such as woollen dolls, jumpers, babies hats and mittens. The money from all except one stall was to pay for central heating inside of the church. The stall that wasn't raising money for the church was selling brass and handmade wooden ornaments which Indian orphans had made to sell. It was a busy and friendly fete. Even though it was raining, a lot of people came,and at the end of the fete they had raised Â£300.
